title: RestEasy Reactive app locks all worker threads

labels.name: triage/out-of-date
labels.description: This issue/PR is no longer valid or relevant

body:
### Describe the bug

An application based on following extensions

- quarkus-resteasy-reactive
- quarkus-resteasy-reactive-jackson
- quarkus-arc

Locks all worker threads while running load tests 

### Expected behavior

all worker threads are in `TIMED_WAITING` state, see attached thread dump

### Actual behavior

application should continue to operate and not lock worker threads

### How to Reproduce?

Build following reproducer with load test (with `mvn clean package`) and then run it (`java -Xmx128M -Dquarkus.log.level=WARN -jar target/quarkus-app/quarkus-run.jar`)

https://github.com/mswiderski/quarkus-rest-reactive-lock-reproducer

I use `ab` tool to just load it and uses following setting

`ab -t 60 -c 5 -p load-data.txt -s 600 -T 'application/json' -H 'Accept:application/json' http://localhost:8080/scripts`

content of the load-data.txt is

`{"lastName": "doe","message": "test","name": "john"}`

Output of the ab program is
````
This is ApacheBench, Version 2.3 <$Revision: 1879490 $>
Copyright 1996 Adam Twiss, Zeus Technology Ltd, http://www.zeustech.net/
Licensed to The Apache Software Foundation, http://www.apache.org/

Benchmarking localhost (be patient)
Completed 5000 requests
Completed 10000 requests
Completed 15000 requests
apr_socket_recv: Operation timed out (60)
Total of 16366 requests completed
````

Screen shot from VisualVM 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/904474/133748208-878e2a74-f70f-4c97-948d-1780df538967.png)


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Darwin MacBook-Pro.local 20.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 20.6.0: Wed Jun 23 00:26:31 PDT 2021; root:xnu-7195.141.2~5/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.11" 2021-04-20

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

not used

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.2.3

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

maven 3.6.3

### Additional information

Thread dump

